intro: Plumatichilos galgulus, commonly known as the Galgulus spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. The plant produces small, clustered yellowish-green flowers that are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its unique appearance, it is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
